case_title: GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Chief Secretary, Services & GAD, Quetta vs GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN
appellant: GOVERNMENT OF BALOCHISTAN through Chief Secretary, Services & GAD, Quetta

accussed_details.name: Zahoor-ul-Haq
allegation: Main accused in embezzlement of Rs. 17,34,000

complaint_summary: The appellant was dismissed from service and ordered to recover Rs. 4,69,894.50 as arrears of land revenue due to alleged negligence and involvement in embezzlement of government funds.
investigation_summary: Multiple inquiries were conducted by the Chief Minister's Inspection Team and other officials. The findings implicated several individuals for negligence and embezzlement, with Zahoor-ul-Haq identified as the main accused and Haider Ali held liable for negligence.
judgment_summary: The tribunal found the impugned order discriminatory against Haider Ali, as other officials charged with similar negligence were exonerated. The appeal was accepted, and the case was remanded for fresh inquiry against all accused persons within four months.
punishment: Impugned order of dismissal and recovery of Rs. 4,69,894.50 set aside. Fresh inquiry ordered.
Decision_or_verdict: Appeal accepted. Impugned order set aside. Case remanded for fresh inquiry.
legal_arguments: Discriminatory treatment of appellant compared to other accused officials.
Failure to provide opportunity for cross-examination.
No overt act or corroborative evidence against appellant.

witness_statement.Zahoor-ul-Haq: Confessed to embezzlement but implicated Haider Ali without corroborative evidence.

summary_vector_notes: The case revolves around allegations of embezzlement and negligence in duty by multiple officials. The tribunal found discriminatory treatment against the appellant and ordered a fresh inquiry against all accused persons.
